item.title: Hollywood now has dueling open letters over the Israel film boycott
item.description: Over 1,200 Hollywood figures, among them Liev Schreiber, Mayim Bialik and Sharon Osbourne, signed a letter on Thursday rejecting a previous call to boycott Israeli film groups.

item.title: Trump advances TikTok deal with new executive order
item.description: The new order says that the deal to turn over a majority stake in TikTok to a group of U.S. investors meets the terms ordered by Congress, and will allow it to stay online in the U.S.

item.title: Trump signs order clearing way for takeover of U.S. version of app
item.description: President Trump on Thursday advanced a deal for a consortium of mostly U.S. investors to take over the hit video app. Trump says software company Oracle will take a major role in the new venture.

item.title: Despite fear, migrants show up for ICE appointments in Dallas and are turned away
item.description: The ICE facility in Dallas where three detainees were killed in a shooting on Wednesday is still closed, but many people with scheduled check-ins still showed up the next day, only to be turned away.

item.title: Trump advises parents on hepatitis B vaccine. Here's why doctors say he's wrong
item.description: It's unusual for Presidents to give medical advise. But this week President Trump told parents to delay giving their kids a hep b shot until they turn 12. Doctors say this is bad and dangerous advice.

item.title: Trump is accusing the U.N. of 'sabotage.' The U.N. says Trump's team is to blame
item.description: Trump says three "sinister events" disrupted his speech: a frozen escalator, a broken teleprompter and a too-quiet sound system. The U.N. says Trump's team is at fault, but it opened an investigation.
